message.content:
{"id": "128359", "title": "The logic is incorrect when a filter is applied to the table layout", "description": "We have a dataset with 10 records (DataResultA). When a filter (FilterB) is added to the table, the actual result is based on DataResultA instead of DataResultB.", "OB": "When dragging the dataset to the layout and setting a filter (FilterB) on the table, the result of FilterB should be based on DataResultB.", "EB": "The logic is not correctly implemented when a filter is added to the table on the layout.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a report and add a new datasource and dataset.
2. Apply a filter (FilterA) to the dataset, resulting in 6 records (DataResultB).
3. Add a filter (FilterB) to the table."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

Creat a report, new a datasource and a dataset2. We set a filter(FilterA) in the dataset, and then the 6 records of the dataset(DataResultB) are gained.3. '}
